(see Bug 32158), I opened the launch config dialog and tried to launch the
auto-generated config manually. The following exception occurred:

I get this NPE every time I create a runtime workbench launch config on
Linux-Motif.

This bug corrupts the workspace metadata such that an error occurs at shutdown
(nothing is logged) and when you restart, all of your projects are missing
from the workbench (they still exist on disk).
I don't see how this can be our bug. Moving to Core for comments.

What VM are you using? 
It looks like a NPE in class library code?
Are you able to write a simple Java program which does "new Date().toString()"?
I'm running on JDK 1.4.1 and a simple program with your test case runs ok.
Do you get the same errors when you shutdown your workspace?

I don't think so, but I'm not sure. I was getting this problem every time I
tried to selfhost on Motif yesterday at the office, but I can't reproduce the
problem this morning from home.

Oops. I just noticed that I referenced the wrong bug report above. In the first
sentence of this report, that should say "(see Bug 32159)".

I haven't been able to reproduce this bug at the office today either. Maybe it
was just a side effect of Bug 32159.

Closing.
Let us know if you experience this again.
